I get a cmake warning with this branch in conjunction with the `eigen3` branch of `ign-cmake`:

~~~
Warnings   << ign_math:cmake /home/scpeters/ws/ignition/logs/ign_math/build.cmake.000.log                                       
CMake Warning (dev) at /home/scpeters/ws/ignition/devel/share/cmake/ignition-cmake1/cmake1/IgnUtils.cmake:361 (message):
   -- THIS MESSAGE IS INTENDED FOR IGNITION-MATH AUTHORS --
      (IF YOU SEE THIS, PLEASE REPORT IT)

  Could not find pkg-config information for EIGEN3.  It was not provided by
  the find-module for the package, nor was it explicitly passed into the call
  to ign_find_package(~).  This is most likely an error in this project's use
  of ign-cmake.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:32 (ign_find_package)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
~~~
content.html:
I get a cmake warning with this branch in conjunction with the eigen3 branch of ign-cmake:

CMake Warning (dev) at /home/scpeters/ws/ignition/devel/share/cmake/ignition-cmake1/cmake1/IgnUtils.cmake:361 (message):
   -- THIS MESSAGE IS INTENDED FOR IGNITION-MATH AUTHORS --
      (IF YOU SEE THIS, PLEASE REPORT IT)

  Could not find pkg-config information for EIGEN3.  It was not provided by
  the find-module for the package, nor was it explicitly passed into the call
  to ign_find_package(~).  This is most likely an error in this project's use
  of ign-cmake.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:32 (ign_find_package)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.

content.raw: usually I'm advocating for big pull requests to be split into smaller pieces, but I would consider merging those into a single pull request from `InterfaceLibraries_eigen3` unless we have a good way to test them independently. The `FindEIGEN3` module is bit orthogonal, but if it serves as the test-case for the `INTERFACE` code, I would lump them together.
content.html: usually I'm advocating for big pull requests to be split into smaller pieces, but I would consider merging those into a single pull request from InterfaceLibraries_eigen3 unless we have a good way to test them independently. The FindEIGEN3 module is bit orthogonal, but if it serves as the test-case for the INTERFACE code, I would lump them together.

pull_request.title: Component for converting between eigen3 and ignition-math (part of #19)

pullrequest.title: Component for converting between eigen3 and ignition-math (part of #19)

content.html:
This should now be working with the InterfaceLibraries_eigen3 branch of ign-cmake.

The following can be used as test code:

# CMakeLists.txt
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5.1)
find_package(ignition-math5 COMPONENTS eigen3)
add_executable(dummy dummy.cpp)
target_link_libraries(dummy ignition-math5::eigen3)

(next file:)

// dummy.cpp

#include <iostream>
#include <ignition/math/eigen3/Conversions.hh>
#include <Eigen/Geometry>

int main()
{
  Eigen::Vector3d vecEig = Eigen::Vector3d(1.0, 2.0, 3.0);
  ignition::math::Vector3d vecIgn = ignition::math::eigen3::convert(vecEig);

  std::cout << vecIgn << std::endl;
}

content.raw:
We can definitely do much better than this in terms of conversion functions (and I say that as the person who wrote this file).

I think the header-only aspect is fine, maybe even preferable. It'll give us a chance to explore exporting header-only libraries.
content.html:
We can definitely do much better than this in terms of conversion functions (and I say that as the person who wrote this file).

I think the header-only aspect is fine, maybe even preferable. It'll give us a chance to explore exporting header-only libraries.

pullrequest.title: Component for converting between eigen3 and ignition-math (part of #19)

content.raw:
This would be our first header-only library, so we don't have explicit support for it in `ign-cmake` yet.

We can add an `INTERFACE` option to `ign_add_component(~)` which can indicate that it's an "interface target", and therefore can skip most of the usual work that's done for compiled libraries.
content.html:
This would be our first header-only library, so we don't have explicit support for it in ign-cmake yet.

We can add an INTERFACE option to ign_add_component(~) which can indicate that it's an "interface target", and therefore can skip most of the usual work that's done for compiled libraries.
